intro: Hieracium orphnotrichoides, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Hieracium orphnotrichoides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
